title: Job Openings at Westfield Consulting
content:
Westfield Consulting was founded in January 2012, by a team of Nigerians with over 45 years of cumulative work experience in management and consultancy. Westfield Consulting is a provider of Human Resource and Strategic Management Services.

Our focus on innovation and excellence in service delivery has made us a first choice to our growing clientele in various sectors. We have successfully achieved a positive work force attitude, while engineering a more motivated and committed workforce for our clients with notable results Our results provide a testament about the quality of our services. 70% of our business is repeat business.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Information Technology

Job Purpose


	Sales Manager to help the organization in meeting its customer acquisition and revenue growth targets by keeping our company competitive and innovative.
	He/she will be responsible for maximizing our sales team potential, crafting sales plans and justifying those plans to the upper management.


Key Responsibilities


	Achieve growth and hit sales targets by successfully managing the Sales team.
	Assess the strengths and weaknesses of the Sales team and manage the Sales program accordingly.
	Provide on-the-ground support for Sales Representatives as they generate leads and close new deals.
	Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands company’s customer base and ensure its strong presence
	Own recruiting, objectives setting, coaching, performance review and reward of Sales representatives.
	Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships by partnering with clients and understanding their needs.
	Present sales, revenue and expenses reports and realistic forecasts to the management team.
	Identify emerging markets and market shifts while being fully aware of new products and competition status.
	Plan to ensure achievement of divisional and personal target, aligning with company sales policies and strategies.
	Manage, develop, coach, control and motivate the sales force to develop their skill to ensure that a high professional standard is achieved and monthly sales target and KPI target are met.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / M.Sc. Degree in Business Administration or a related field.
	8+ years of experience selling IT / enterprise solutions to major accounts.
	Successful previous experience as a Sales Representative or Sales Manager, consistently meeting or exceeding targets.
	Strong experience in selling IT solutions
	Committed to continuous education through workshops, seminars and conferences
	Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization.
	Proven ability to drive the Sales process from plan to close.
	Strong business sense and industry expertise.
	Excellent mentoring, coaching and people management skills.


Salary
Very attractive (plus Performance Commission).

Application Closing Date: 10th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their current CV to: victor.allu@westfield-consulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email. 

Note: Only candidates with experience in selling IT solutions will be contacted. Thank you.

 

 

2.) Accountant

Job Location: Lagos Mainland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Fully On-Site
Report To: Managing Director

Job Summary


	The Accountant is responsible for managing day-to-day financial transactions and maintaining accurate financial records, ensuring compliance with internal controls, tax regulations, and reporting requirements.
	This role supports financial reporting, payroll management, inventory reconciliation, and procurement-related financial documentation, with a strong emphasis on accuracy, timeliness, and regulatory compliance.


Principal Duties and Responsibilities 


	Financial Record-Keeping & Transactions
	
		Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all financial transactions.
		Process payments, invoices, and receipts in accordance with financial policies.
		Conduct bank reconciliations and ensure financial records match bank statements.
		Ensure proper documentation for all financial transactions.
	
	
	Accounts Payable & Receivable Management
	
		Process vendor payments and ensure all invoices are properly approved and recorded.
		Manage accounts receivable, invoicing clients and following up on outstanding payments.
		Work with procurement to ensure vendor contracts align with financial policies.
	
	
	Payroll & Employee Benefits Administration
	
		Prepare payroll calculations and ensure timely salary disbursement.
		Ensure statutory deductions (PAYE, pensions, NHF, VAT) are processed correctly and remitted.
		Maintain confidential payroll records and ensure compliance with labor regulations.
	
	
	Tax Compliance & Financial Audits
	
		Prepare tax filings and ensure timely payment of all statutory obligations.
		Support the CFO in preparing financial reports for external audits.
		Ensure all financial records are audit-ready and compliant with regulatory standards.
	
	
	Budgeting & Expense Monitoring
	
		Assist in preparing annual budgets and financial forecasts.
		Track expenses against budget allocations and report any variances to the CFO.
		Support in financial planning efforts by providing data-driven financial insights.
	
	
	Internal Controls & Financial Integrity
	
		Implement and enforce financial controls to prevent fraud and mismanagement.
		Conduct regular checks on financial processes to ensure compliance.
		Report any discrepancies or financial risks to the CFO.
	
	


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	2 - 3 years of experience in financial accounting.
	Strong understanding of tax regulations, financial reporting, and compliance.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Xero) and Microsoft Excel.
	High attention to detail and accuracy in financial record-keeping.


Renumeration
Attractive.

Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their recent CV to: victor.allu@westfield-consulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Communications Officer (Content Creator / Social Media)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Communications Officer (Content Creation & Social Media) will be responsible fordeveloping engaging written, visual, and multimedia content that strengthens brand presence across digital platforms.
	This role combines creativity with strategic communication, ensuring our messages resonate with target audiences including clients, partners, and stakeholders.
	The position supports the Communications & Branding Manager in implementing Group-wide communication strategies, while focusing on content production, social media management, and digital storytelling.


Key Responsibilities
Content Creation:


	Write blog posts, articles, newsletters, email campaigns, and press pieces that alignwith the Group’s brand voice.
	Develop creative assets such as infographics, carousels, and presentations for campaigns and corporate communications.
	Draft scripts and produce short-form video content (Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts).
	Manage website blog updates and collaborate with the design team on visual storytelling.


Social Media & Digital Presence:


	Create, schedule, and publish engaging posts across Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook, and TikTok.
	Monitor community engagement and respond to messages/comments professionally.
	Use tools such as Meta Business Suite, Buffer, or Hootsuite for campaign scheduling and performance tracking.
	Stay updated on digital trends to optimize reach and engagement.


Analytics & Optimization:


	Track social media metrics (reach, engagement, conversions) using Meta Insights, LinkedIn Analytics, and Google Analytics.
	Provide monthly performance reports and recommend improvements.
	Optimize all content for SEO and audience engagement.


Collaboration & Support:


	Work closely with the Communications & Branding Manager to execute campaigns.
	Support Directors and departments with creative content for projects, initiatives, and events.
	Assist in developing materials for corporate presentations, brand showcases, and PR events.


Skills & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Marketing, Journalism, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
	2 - 4 years of experience in content creation, copywriting, or social media management.
	Strong writing and editing skills in English with attention to detail.
	Proficiency in content design and editing tools: Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Rush, CapCut, InShot.
	Familiarity with CMS (WordPress, Notion), SEO tools (Yoast, SEMrush, Ubersuggest).
	Knowledge of social scheduling and analytics tools (Meta Suite, Hootsuite, Buffer, Later).
	Creative thinker with proven ability to adapt tone and style for different audiences.
	Organized, deadline-driven, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously.


Bonus Advantage:


	Experience creating viral/short-form video content.
	Prior corporate communications or agency experience.
	Basic knowledge of email marketing platforms (Mailchimp, Brevo).


Remuneration
Very Attractive.

Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their recent CV to: victor.allu@westfield-consulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Mai Shayi Coffe Roasters
content:
Mai Shayi Coffe Roasters is a specialty coffee company focused on revitalizing the country's coffee sector through sustainable farming, processing, and high-end coffee experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Stocks and Requisition Account Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Purpose of the Role
     

            
    




	The Stocks and Requisition Account Officer will be responsible for the effective management, reconciliation, and reporting of inventory and requisition processes across the restaurant and specialty coffee business.
	This role ensures accurate stock control, cost optimization, vendor management, and compliance with internal financial and operational standards.
	The ideal candidate is an Accountant (ACA/ACCA or equivalent) with a minimum of 5 years’ proven experience in inventory, stock, requisition, and vendor management within the F&B or high-end restaurant/café industry.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of raw materials, beverages, consumables, and finished goods across all outlets and central store.
	Monitor daily, weekly, and monthly stock movements and investigate variances between actual and system stock balances.
	Oversee and coordinate physical stock counts, cycle counts, and periodic audits to ensure accuracy and accountability.
	Implement controls to prevent stock pilferage, wastage, and mismanagement, ensuring compliance with company policies.
	Develop and enforce stock rotation policies (FIFO/FEFO) to minimize losses.
	Review and approve requisition requests in line with operational and budgetary requirements.
	Track requisition flows from initiation to fulfillment and ensure proper authorization processes are followed.
	Manage vendor relationships, negotiate favorable terms, and evaluate supplier performance to ensure value-for-money procurement.
	Reconcile stock ledgers with the general ledger and ensure accurate reflection in financial statements.
	Track cost of goods sold (COGS) and analyze variances between actual and standard costs.
	Generate and present stock and requisition reports (daily, weekly, and monthly) to Finance and Management.
	Provide accurate stock records and reconciliations to support audits and compliance checks.
	Supervise and manage stock/requisition accounting systems, ERP platforms, and POS back-end integration.
	Train and coach junior staff on stock, requisition, and vendor management processes.
	Continuously review and improve stock and requisition systems to strengthen efficiency, accuracy, and transparency.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy of stock records vs. physical counts.
	Timeliness and completeness of stock, requisition, and vendor reports.
	Reduced stock variances, shrinkage, and wastage.
	Vendor cost savings and performance compliance.
	Level of adherence to internal controls and approval hierarchies.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Professional Certification: Chartered Accountant (ACA, ACCA, or equivalent)
	Experience: At least 5 years of progressive experience in stock, requisition, inventory accounting, and vendor management within the Food & Beverage sector or large high-end restaurants/cafés.
	Education: Bachelor’s Degree/HND in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Strong knowledge of F&B costing, recipe costing, and COGS analysis.
	Proven ability to set up and manage stock, requisition, and vendor control systems.
	Proficiency in accounting/ERP software and advanced MS Excel skills.
	Excellent negotiation, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
	High integrity, detail-oriented, and results-driven with the ability to work under pressure.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills for cross-department and vendor collaboration.


Application Closing Date: 26th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chris@maishayicoffee.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Procurement Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Position Overview


	The Procurement Officer will provide strategic leadership and hands-on management of all procurement, supply chain, and vendor management activities across Mai Shayi Coffee Roasters Limited.
	The role is central to ensuring that every branded product, raw material, and operational item aligns with the company’s premium quality standards.
	The successful candidate must bring a minimum of 8 years’ progressive experience in procurement within high-end restaurants or the hospitality industry, with proven expertise in cost optimization, supplier performance management, and inventory control.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and implement procurement strategies aligned with the company’s growth objectives, hospitality industry benchmarks, and sustainability goals.
	Develop policies, procedures, and standards for transparent, efficient, and cost-effective procurement operations.
	Lead procurement planning cycles, aligning forecasts with restaurant operations, seasonal demands, and promotional activities.
	Identify, evaluate, and onboard suppliers that meet the company’s quality, ethical, and financial standards.
	Build and maintain long-term, trust-based relationships with local and international suppliers.
	Negotiate favorable contracts, pricing, and service level agreements to maximize value for the company.
	Continuously assess supplier performance against KPIs such as quality, reliability, timeliness, and cost efficiency.
	Establish reorder levels, stock control systems, and supply chain monitoring tools to prevent shortages or wastage.
	Oversee the procurement of premium coffee beans, branded consumables (e.g., packaging, takeaway cups/bags), ingredients, equipment, and other operational essentials.
	Collaborate closely with operations, finance, and store managers to forecast requirements and ensure uninterrupted service delivery.
	Implement best practices for storage, stock rotation, and shelf-life management, particularly for perishable items.
	Develop and manage the procurement budget, ensuring cost savings without compromising quality.
	Monitor market trends, exchange rate fluctuations, and inflationary pressures to anticipate risks and adjust strategies.
	Ensure all procurement activities comply with internal controls, corporate governance, and Nigerian regulatory requirements.
	Provide accurate, timely reports and analysis to senior management, highlighting opportunities for optimization and risk mitigation.
	Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing procurement team, fostering a culture of accountability, innovation, and continuous improvement.
	Conduct training and knowledge-sharing sessions on procurement best practices, compliance, and hospitality supply chain trends.
	Promote teamwork and collaboration across departments to achieve shared organizational goals.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree/HND in Supply Chain Management, Procurement, Business Administration, Hospitality Management, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of progressive procurement experience in high-end restaurants, luxury hospitality, or food & beverage organizations, with at least 4 years in a managerial role.
	Professional certifications such as CIPS, ISM, or equivalent are desirable.
	Strong knowledge of hospitality procurement systems, vendor networks, and international sourcing for premium goods.
	Demonstrated ability to negotiate complex contracts and deliver measurable cost savings.
	Proficiency in ERP systems, procurement software, and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Exceptional analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
	High level of integrity, ethics, and professionalism.
	Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence at all levels.


Core Competencies:


	Strategic Thinking & Planning
	Supplier & Contract Management
	Inventory Optimization & Forecasting
	Financial Acumen & Cost Control
	Leadership & Team Development
	Quality Assurance & Compliance
	Negotiation & Influencing Skills
	Customer-Centric Supply Chain Orientation.


Application Closing Date: 26th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chris@maishayicoffee.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Grounds and Facilities Officer

Job Location: Abuja

Job Purpose


	The Grounds and Maintenance Officer is responsible for ensuring the cleanliness, safety, and functionality all of the company’s outdoor and structural facilities.
	The role involves maintaining grounds, conducting minor repairs, monitoring generators and fuel, checking electrical appliances such as air conditioning systems, supporting gate and parking operations, and assisting with events.
	The officer ensures that the environment is well-maintained, safe, and presents a positive impression to staff, guests, and customers.


Key Responsibilities
Grounds and Outdoor Cleaning:


	Empty and clean outdoor trash bins while ensuring waste segregation.
	Remove debris from outdoor drains to prevent blockages and flooding.
	Ensure outdoor areas (signage, lamps, fixtures) are cleaned and maintained regularly.


Property Maintenance and Repairs:


	Conduct daily checks on lighting, plumbing, gates, fences, and electrical appliances (e.g., fans, air conditioners, refrigerators, water dispensers).
	Carry out minor repairs such as replacing bulbs, tightening screws, and patching small defects.
	Record maintenance activities in the logbook and escalate major issues (e.g., leaks, electrical faults, AC malfunctions, structural damage).
	Perform weekly inspections and basic servicing of equipment, tools, and drainage systems.
	Monitor air conditioning systems for performance issues, unusual noises, leaks, or temperature irregularities and report promptly.


Generator Monitoring and Fuel Management:


	Inspect generator diesel levels daily and ensure a minimum of 100 liters is available at all times.
	Record fuel levels and generator condition in the logbook.
	Conduct test runs and basic servicing checks weekly.
	Report abnormalities (leaks, unusual noises, low fuel) immediately.


Electrical Appliances & AC System Support:


	Carry out routine checks on electrical appliances including air conditioners, water dispensers, refrigerators, fans, and lighting systems.
	Clean AC filters regularly and ensure timely servicing by specialists when required.
	Detect and report faults (e.g., overheating, wiring issues, reduced cooling efficiency).
	Switch off electrical appliances not in use to save energy and prevent hazards.


Gate and Parking Operations:


	Monitor vehicle movements and guide visitors to designated parking areas when required.
	Ensure driveways and access points remain clear at all times.
	Support security personnel with vehicle management when required.


Event and Special Duty Support:


	Assist in setting up outdoor spaces for events, including tents, chairs, and decorations.
	Clear and restore areas after events.
	Provide logistical support to staff and guests during special functions.


Safety and Hygiene Compliance:


	Consistently wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).
	Identify and report hazards immediately (e.g., oil spills, broken fences, loose wires, faulty AC units).
	Use safety signage when cleaning or working in risky areas.
	Ensure safe storage of tools, fuel, and chemicals after use.


Waste Management:


	Empty bins before overflow and replace liners promptly.
	Dispose of waste properly at designated points.
	Separate recyclable and non-recyclable waste.


Reporting and Documentation:


	Maintain accurate daily records of inspections, repairs, and generator fuel levels.
	Provide reports on hazards, faults, and recurring issues for long-term solutions.
	Track stock levels of consumables, fuel, and maintenance supplies.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Cleanliness and orderliness of grounds and outdoor spaces.
	Timely response to maintenance and repair requests.
	Compliance with generator fuel minimum threshold.
	Effective monitoring of air conditioning and electrical appliances.
	Accurate and up-to-date record-keeping in logbooks.
	Adherence to safety and hygiene protocols.
	Positive feedback from staff, guests, and management.


Qualifications, Skills, and Experience
Education & Experience:


	Minimum of OND.
	At least 2 – 3 years of experience in groundskeeping, maintenance, or facility support roles.
	Vocational training in facility maintenance, electrical, plumbing, or related field (mandatory).
	Experience in basic electrical systems and air conditioning maintenance is an added advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Basic knowledge of electrical, plumbing, air conditioning, and general repairs.
	Ability to operate and maintain tools, equipment, and generators.
	Good physical fitness and ability to perform manual tasks.
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Basic record-keeping and reporting ability.
	Good communication skills and courteous in dealing with staff and visitors.


Personal Attributes:


	Safety-conscious and disciplined.
	Proactive and dependable with a strong work ethic.
	Team player with a service-oriented attitude.
	Flexible and willing to work during events or emergencies.
